intro: Melaleuca marginata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved paperbark, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy floral spikes. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy soils, often forming dense thickets. Its bark is fibrous and peels away in strips, giving it a distinctive appearance. Melaleuca marginata is also noted for its ability to thrive in saline environments, making it a hardy species in coastal regions.
